meanings.definition: A student in the first or second year of high school or college.
meanings.sent1: The underclassmen were excited to start their first year of high school.
meanings.sent2: The underclassmen attended the orientation session for new students.
meanings.sent3: The underclassmen decided to form a study group to tackle their challenging courses together.
meanings.sent4: In the school of life, the underclassmen are just beginning their journey.
meanings.sent5: The underclassmen's enthusiasm for learning was contagious.

meanings.definition: A member of a class or group that is below another in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: The underclassmen in the company were eager to prove themselves to the senior employees.
meanings.sent2: The underclassmen were assigned tasks that required guidance from the upper management.
meanings.sent3: The underclassmen jokingly referred to themselves as the 'junior league' of the office.
meanings.sent4: In the world of superheroes, the sidekicks are often seen as the underclassmen of the hero community.
meanings.sent5: The underclassmen worked hard to climb the ranks and earn respect within the organization.
